definition: to put on a suit of armor/to put on dress/to wear
to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

sentences.english: Cao Xiu donned his armor and rode into the city with 1, 000 men to stop the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 休急披挂上马，引千余人在城中拒敌。

sentences.english: He was past sixty and had a long white beard curling down over his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他已年过六旬，银白色蜷曲的长髯披挂胸前。

sentences.english: Even though you didn't play, did you always watch the matches your team mates played?
sentences.chinese: 尽管自己不能披挂上阵，你会经常看队友们的比赛吗？

sentences.english: The man who is ostentatious of his modesty is twin to the statue that wears a fig-leaf.
sentences.chinese: 卖弄谦虚者跟披挂无花果树叶的塑像没什么两样。

sentences.english: A knight in pale pink armor appeared above me.
sentences.chinese: 一个披挂着浅粉红色盔甲的骑士出现在我的上方。

sentences.english: Heavily armed foot soldier of ancient Greece whose function was to fight in close formation.
sentences.chinese: 古代希腊披挂重型甲胄的步兵，以密集队形进行战斗。

sentences.english: Bynum was also the only 7-footer not in uniform jumping around with the rest of the team in its pregame huddle.
sentences.chinese: 拜纳姆是湖人队中唯一一个没有披挂上阵的7尺高人。

sentences.english: Armor was used by the soldiers to protect themselves in the cold weapon era.
sentences.chinese: 铠甲是冷兵器战争时代将士披挂在身上的防护装具。

definition: fully armed/armed to the teeth/fig. fully equipped
